Both triangles $APD$ and $CBD$ are 30-60-90 triangles.  Thus $DP=\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{3}$ and $DB=2$. Since $\angle
BDP=\angle PBD$, it follows that $PB=PD=\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{3}$. Hence the perimeter of $\triangle BDP$ is $\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{3}+\frac{2\sqrt{3}}{3}+2={2+\frac{4\sqrt{3}}{3}}$.  Converting this to our contrived notation gives $w + x + y + z = \boxed{12}$.
